com.undercamber

Class TestManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.undercamber.TestManager

  • public final class TestManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The primary interface between Undercamber and one test.

    Each test must implement TestUnit, and each test is passed a unique TestManager. Each test must call an overload of initialize(SubtestSequencingMode,String,SubtestContinuationMode,Prerequisite[],Tag[],Requirement...) exactly once.

      • initialize

        public final boolean initialize(Requirement... requirements)
                         throws UserError
        A convenience method. Equivalent to 
         initialize( SubtestSequencingMode.SEQUENTIAL_ABORT_SEQUENCE_ON_ERROR,
             null,
             SubtestContinuationMode.SKIP_SUBTESTS_IF_LOCAL_TESTS_FAIL,
             new Prerequisite[0],
             new Tag[0],
             requirements );
        Parameters:
        requirements - The requirements that this test will either verify or help verify.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether this test should run its validation checks.
           true: Validation checks should be run
           false: validation checks should not be run
        Throws:
        UserError - If there is a configuration error
        See Also:
        initialize( SubtestSequencingMode, String, SubtestContinuationMode, Prerequisite[], Tag[], Requirement... )

      • initialize

        public final boolean initialize(java.lang.String argument,
                                Requirement... requirements)
                         throws UserError
        A convenience method. Equivalent to 
         initialize( SubtestSequencingMode.SEQUENTIAL_ABORT_SEQUENCE_ON_ERROR,
             argument,
             SubtestContinuationMode.SKIP_SUBTESTS_IF_LOCAL_TESTS_FAIL,
             new Prerequisite[0],
             new Tag[0],
             requirements );
        Parameters:
        argument - A string used to provide uniqueness.
        Undercamber does not have a way to discover the arguments of the test methods, so different tests whose signature differs only in the argument list are indistinguishable to Undercamber. This argument can provide uniqueness.

        Also, different calls to the same test will have identical signatures, and this argument can be used to provide uniqueness.

        Not all tests that are indistinguishable to Undercamber need to be made unique via this parameter. This is needed only for:
        • Uniquely specifying prerequisites
        • Uniquely specifying tests on the Undercamber command line
        requirements - The requirements that this test will either verify or help verify.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether this test should run its validation checks.
           true: Validation checks should be run
           false: validation checks should not be run
        Throws:
        UserError - If there is a configuration error
        See Also:
        initialize( SubtestSequencingMode, String, SubtestContinuationMode, Prerequisite[], Tag[], Requirement... )

      • initialize

        public final boolean initialize(SubtestSequencingMode subtestSequencingMode,
                                java.lang.String argument,
                                SubtestContinuationMode subtestContinuationMode,
                                Prerequisite[] prerequisites,
                                Tag[] tags,
                                Requirement... requirements)
                         throws UserError
        Initialize the test manager.

        Each test is given a unique TestManager object, and the test should call one of the overloaded versions of this method just once.
        Parameters:
        subtestSequencingMode - Indicates how subtests should be sequenced. Has no effect if the test has no subtests
        argument - A string used to provide uniqueness.
        Undercamber does not have a way to discover the arguments of the test methods, so different tests whose signature differs only in the argument list are indistinguishable to Undercamber. This argument can provide uniqueness.

        Also, different calls to the same test will have identical signatures, and this argument can be used to provide uniqueness.

        Not all tests that are indistinguishable to Undercamber need to be made unique via this parameter. This is needed only for:
        • Uniquely specifying prerequisites
        • Uniquely specifying tests on the Undercamber command line
        subtestContinuationMode - Indicates how the subtests should be handled if this test fails.
        prerequisites - The prerequisites to this test
        tags - The tags on this test. Tags are used to group tests so that a group can be specified on the Undercamber command line.
        requirements - The requirements that this test will either verify or help verify.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether this test should run its validation checks. During the first pass (the discovery pass), this will be false. During the second pass (the validation pass), this will be true.
           true: Validation checks should be run
           false: validation checks should not be run
        Throws:
        UserError - If there is a configuration error

      • toArray

        public static final Prerequisite[] toArray(Prerequisite... prerequisites)
        A convenience method. This just returns the arguments as an array. This is useful for building arguments to the initialize(...) function.
        Parameters:
        prerequisites - The Prerequisites to be stuffed into an array
        Returns:
        The array of prerequisites

      • toArray

        public static final Tag[] toArray(Tag... tags)
        A convenience method. This just returns the arguments as an array. This is useful for building arguments to the initialize(...) function.
        Parameters:
        tags - The Tags to be stuffed into an array
        Returns:
        The array of Tags

      • toArray

        public static final Requirement[] toArray(Requirement... requirements)
        A convenience method. This just returns the arguments as an array. This is useful for building arguments to the initialize(...) function.
        Parameters:
        requirements - The Requirements to be stuffed into an array
        Returns:
        The array of requirements

      • addPrerequisite

        public final void addPrerequisite(Prerequisite prerequisite)
                           throws UserError
        For adding a prerequisite.

        Prerequisites can be added while the test is running. Prerequisites are collected and recorded during the discovery phase. Prerequisites supplied to Undercamber during the execution phase are ignored.
        Parameters:
        prerequisite - The prerequisite to add to the test.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the prerequisite cannot be found

      • addSubtest

        public final void addSubtest(TestUnit testUnit)
                      throws UserError
        Add a subtest.

        The subtests are executed AFTER the parent test is executed. The subtests are executed in the same order as the calls to this method.
        Parameters:
        testUnit - The subtest to be added.
        Throws:
        UserError - If this method is called when tests are not running

      • addException

        public final void addException(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Add an exception. If a test adds any exceptions. Undercamber will consider the test a failure. If a test throws any exceptions, Undercamber will consider the test a failure.
        Parameters:
        throwable - The exception to be added.

      • addException

        public final void addException(java.util.List<java.lang.Throwable> throwables)
        Add exceptions. If a test adds any exceptions. Undercamber will consider the test a failure. If a test throws any exceptions, Undercamber will consider the test a failure.
        Parameters:
        throwables - The exception to be added.

      • addException

        public final void addException(java.lang.Throwable... throwables)
        Add exceptions. If a test adds any exceptions. Undercamber will consider the test a failure. If a test throws any exceptions, Undercamber will consider the test a failure.
        Parameters:
        throwables - The exception to be added.

      • addMessage

        public final void addMessage(java.lang.String... message)
        Add an multi-line informational message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message. Each string is one line of the message

      • addMessage

        public final void addMessage(java.util.List<java.lang.String> message)
        Add an multi-line informational message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message. Each string is one line of the message

      • addMessage

        public final void addMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Add a one-line informational message
        Parameters:
        message - The message.

      • addCompletionCallback

        public final void addCompletionCallback(CompletionCallback completionCallback)
                                 throws UserError
        Add a callback to be notified when tests are complete.

        Callbacks are notified after all tests are complete, but before any calls to Requirement.testComplete(com.undercamber.TestData).

        CompletionCallback objects passed to TestManager during the first pass (the discovery pass) are retained, and these objects are notified of test completion. CompletionCallback objects passed during the second pass are ignored.

        Parameters:
        completionCallback - The callback to be notified after all tests are complete.
        Throws:
        UserError - If this method is called when the tests are not being run.

      • isDiscoveryPass

        public final boolean isDiscoveryPass()
        Is this the first pass?
        Returns:
           true: it is the first (discovery) pass
           false: it is the second (validation) pass

      • getHeading

        public final java.lang.String getHeading()
        Get a one-line description of the test. The description is constructed from the test's class, the test's method, and the argument, if any
        Returns:
        The description

      • getSubtestSequencingMode

        public final SubtestSequencingMode getSubtestSequencingMode()
        Get the SubtestSequencingMode. This indicates how Undercamber will sequence the subtests.
        Returns:
        The SubtestSequencingMode

      • getPrerequisites

        public final Prerequisite[] getPrerequisites()
        Get the Prerequisites for this test.
        Returns:
        The Prerequisites

      • getJVMCommand

        public final java.lang.String getJVMCommand()
        Get the command used to invoke the JVM. This does not include the parameters passed to the JVM.
        Returns:
        The JVM command

      • getTestSetName

        public final java.lang.String getTestSetName()
        Get the test set name. Test sets are specified in the Undercamber configuration file. Each test set is run in a different process.
        Returns:
        The name of this test's test set.

      • getThreadCount

        public final int getThreadCount()
        Get the thread count. Note that this might be different between the first pass (the discovery pass) and the second pass (the validation pass).
        Returns:
        The capacity of the thread pool.

      • getPass1ThreadCount

        public final int getPass1ThreadCount()
        Get the thread count used in the first pass (the discovery pass).
        Returns:
        The capacity of the thread pool during the first pass.

      • getPass2ThreadCount

        public final int getPass2ThreadCount()
        Get the thread count used in the second pass (the validation pass).
        Returns:
        The capacity of the thread pool during the second pass.

      • getSubtestContinuationMode

        public final SubtestContinuationMode getSubtestContinuationMode()
        Get the SubtestContinuationMode. This indicates how Undercamber should handle this test's subtests if this test fails.
        Returns:
        The SubtestContinuationMode

      • getParameters

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getParameters()
        Get the test parameters for this test suite. Parameters are specified in the Undercamber configuration file and on the Undercamber command line
        Returns:
        The parameters

      • getFollowingParameterAsString

        public final java.lang.String getFollowingParameterAsString(java.lang.String parameter)
                                                     throws UserError
        Get the parameter following the specified parameter. This is a convenience method to help parse the test parameters. For example, if the parameters include a flag/value pair, this method can provide the value, given the flag.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The name of the specified parameter
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter immediately following the specified parameter
        Throws:
        UserError - If the specified parameter does not exist, or if the specified parameter is the last in the list of parameters.

      • getFollowingParameterAsInteger

        public final int getFollowingParameterAsInteger(java.lang.String parameter)
                                         throws UserError
        Get the parameter following the specified parameter, interpreted as an integer. This is a convenience method to help parse the test parameters. For example, if the parameters include a flag/value pair, this method can provide the value, given the flag.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The name of the specified parameter
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter immediately following the specified parameter
        Throws:
        UserError - If the specified parameter does not exist, or if the specified parameter is the last in the list of parameters, or if the parameter is not an integer.

      • getFollowingParameterAsLong

        public final long getFollowingParameterAsLong(java.lang.String parameter)
                                       throws UserError
        Get the parameter following the specified parameter,interpreted as a long. This is a convenience method to help parse the test parameters. For example, if the parameters include a flag/value pair, this method can provide the value, given the flag.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The name of the specified parameter
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter immediately following the specified parameter
        Throws:
        UserError - If the specified parameter does not exist, or if the specified parameter is the last in the list of parameters, or if the parameter is not a long.

      • getFollowingParameterAsDouble

        public final double getFollowingParameterAsDouble(java.lang.String parameter)
                                           throws UserError
        Get the parameter following the specified parameter, interpreted as a double. This is a convenience method to help parse the test parameters. For example, if the parameters include a flag/value pair, this method can provide the value, given the flag.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The name of the specified parameter
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter immediately following the specified parameter
        Throws:
        UserError - If the specified parameter does not exist, or if the specified parameter is the last in the list of parameters, or if the parameter is not a double.

      • containsParameter

        public final boolean containsParameter(java.lang.String parameter)
        Determine whether a parameter is present. This is a convenience method to help determine if a simple flag is present on the command line.
        Parameters:
        parameter - The parameter name
        Returns:
           true: The specified parameter is present
           false: The specified parameter is not present

      • getUserWorkingDirectory

        public final java.io.File getUserWorkingDirectory()
        Get the directory created by Undercamber specifically as a work space for the tests. Tests are not required to use this directory; this is provided as a convenience. The directory is guaranted to be empty.
        Returns:
        The work directory
